awd_titl_txt: RUI:  Microsite Adaptation in Bryophyte Populations
awd_abstract_narration: Bryophytes exhibit a wide range of breeding systems which may                   result in divergent patterns of gene flow.  Differences in gene                 flow may influence the species potential for microsite adaptation.              Thus, species of contrasting reproductive mode are included in this             study of local differentiation.  Patterns of gene flow dispersal of             spores, gametes and asexual propagules will be assessed.  These                 studies are based on 3 years of field experiments and laboratory                analysis.  The proposal offers significant opportunities for                    research collaboration for undergraduates and provides funds for                faculty research at an institution primarily devoted to teaching.               The proposed research will enhance our understanding of the role of             selection and environmental heterogeneity in the maintenance of                 genetic diversity, and add to our knowledge of the reproductive                 ecology of a little-studied, but ubiquitous group of organisms.

pgm_ref.pgm_ref_txt: REU SUPP-Res Exp for Ugrd Supp
